SEARCH
Package domain

Class Valley

java.lang.Object
domain.Valley
public class Valley extends Object
The Valley class represents the simulation environment where all units (animals and resources) live and interact. The valley is structured as a two-dimensional grid where each cell can hold a single Unit. This class manages the placement, movement, and behavior execution of all units in the simulation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Valley()
    Constructs a new Valley with a fixed size and initializes all positions as empty.

  • Constructor Details

    • Valley

      public Valley()
      Constructs a new Valley with a fixed size and initializes all positions as empty. Some default units (wolves and sheep) are placed using the someUnits() method.

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the total size of the valley.
      Returns:
      integer representing the number of rows and columns.

    • getUnit

      public Unit getUnit(int r, int c)
      Returns the unit located at the specified position in the grid.
      Parameters:
      r - Row index of the position.
      c - Column index of the position.
      Returns:
      the Unit at that position, or null if empty.

    • setUnit

      public void setUnit(int r, int c, Unit e)
      Sets a unit at the specified position in the valley.
      Parameters:
      r - Row index where the unit will be placed.
      c - Column index where the unit will be placed.
      e - The Unit object to insert.

    • someUnits

      public void someUnits()
      Adds some initial units to the valley (wolves and sheep) in predefined positions. This helps initialize the simulation with some entities to observe behavior.

    • neighborsEquals

      public int neighborsEquals(int r, int c)
      Counts how many neighboring units of the same class are adjacent to the given position.
      Parameters:
      r - Row index of the reference unit.
      c - Column index of the reference unit.
      Returns:
      number of neighboring units of the same type.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty(int r, int c)
      Checks whether the specified position in the valley is empty.
      Parameters:
      r - Row index to check.
      c - Column index to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is inside the valley and has no unit.

    • ticTac

      public void ticTac()
      Executes one simulation step ("Tic-tac") across the entire valley. Each unit that exists in the valley performs its act() method. This simulates one round of activity for all entities.
